page.title: 03Springburn Fire Station
page.content: Built c1900 the Station at the corner of Springburn Rd and Keppochhill Road has 2 appliances each of which holds 320 gallons of water.Staff of Station Officer,Sub Officer,Leading Fireman and 49 firemen cover the area from M8 north to Colston Rd,east of Balmore Rd to Pinkston Rd,but could be sent to a fire anywhere in Strathclyde.Duty cycle is 2 day shifts from 0800-1800, followed by 2 night shifts 1800-0800, then 4 days off.They have 24 working days holiday per year.The fire engines are called out for many reasons other than fires eg accidents,stuck lifts, chemical spillages etc.There were 168 calls in May 1985,18 being hoax calls. Six families live in the Station but none is attached to it.The Station is to be replaced in 18 months with a new one in Auchentoshan Terrace,which lies just to the south off Springburn Road.
